155.title: More Family members

choices: Jim's and his cousin's families follow his plan
1552.content:
"You want us to what!? Mom, Day, you can't be serious... You know what being conjoined means, right?" Jim looked back and forth between his parents. From their solemn looks, Jim figured that they knew what being joined in such an extreme way would mean. "There has to be other ways to save money..."

"I'm sorry son; its not just about saving money. With the food and water shortages..." His father sighed heavily and placed a hand on Jim's shoulder. "This is a solution several families have already adopted. We will not be alone in this transition."

"Being alone will never be a problem now!" He brushed off his father's hand and turned around. Jim glanced at his siblings, and the other members of his family in the waiting room. He was going to be permanently bound to one of them, sharing nearly everything with them. He loved everyone in his family, but as he looked around the room, there were more compatible options in his mind than others.

In his immediate family, his parents, Lisa and Jeffrey, had been married for almost 15 years. They were high school sweethearts, and they remained romantically involved into college. Jim, who is now a 17 teen year old high school senior, was the result of their pre-marital relationship. He had actually been a part of his parents wedding as a two year old. After his parents marriage, his younger sister, Amanda, was born. She is 14 years old. After his sister, Jim's parents had three more children: Lydia who is 13, Billy who is 12, and Emma who is 9.

A few years back, Lisa's sister, Charlotte, was forced to move in with them, along with her husband, Robert, and their children. Jacob and Lucas were their identical twin sons, and the same age as Jim, 17. After the twins were Ryan (age 16), Desmond (age 11), and Molly (age 10).

"I'm sorry everyone, but you are all going to have to pair up with someone. It is orders, unfortunately." The doctor spoke from the other side of the room.

Jeff closed his eyes for a few moments, trying to come up with the most rational pairs. It made sense for their parents to pair up; either as couples or by gender. Though, he was unsure how well they would get along if they paired up by gender. His twin cousins would likely pair together, and that would mean he would be best paired with his cousin Ryan. They got really along well, and played on the soccer team together. However, Ryan was gay and he was not. Relationships would be a tricky subject for them.

Next, he imagined that his sisters, Amanda and Lydia, would pair together since they were close in age, and tended to enjoy doing those girlie things together. His youngest siblings would then likely be paired with their cousins, Billy with Desmond and Emma with Molly. He was sure that his youngest sister and cousin would get along just fine, but he questioned if Billy and Desmond would. They fought all the time now, and he could not imagine what a battle between them would look like when they were conjoined.

Jim opened his eyes and hoped that his family would agree with him. The pairings he devised in his mind, seemed to be the best of a terrible circumstance.
